$description:
| What does this do? | Ensures password protection is enabled for on-prem Active Directory and custom banned passwords lists are used. NOTE: users must supply their own custom password list. |
| Why should you use this? | Enhances password security by checking against a list of banned passwords during password change requests. Enforces Entra Password protection for on-premises Active Directory Domain Services in order to prevent the use of weak or leaked passwords. |
| What is the end-user impact? | User education is required. |
| Learn more | [Custom banned password list](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/authentication/concept-password-ban-bad#custom-banned-password-list) |
